summary:
Ever wondered how python web-scraping libraries compare in terms of
speed and accuracy? I'll review lxml, html5lib, BeautifulSoup and scrapy
with a series of sites evaluating how quickly they can parse pages and
how accurately they can find data, particularly pieces of data that
render after DOM loading and other pesky bits like hidden form data,
internationalized data and mobile-compliant sites.
title: Python Scraping Showdown: A performance and accuracy review
